Definition: The given name of an individual, typically distinct from that of other immediate family members of the same generation. First name in Western naming traditions.

SIF.Definition: GivenName: Given name of the person. Note that this element is required if known. However, it may not be possible to know the given name in which case you should add the available information to the FullName element.  PreferredGivenName: The given name preferred most by the person (as written).

OtherStandards.Definition: The given name. Also, known as the first name. preferredFirstName is the user's preferred first name.

LegalDefinitions.LegislationName: Births Deaths and Marriages Act 1996 VIC
LegalDefinitions.Definition:
1. The birth registration statement must state the name of the child.
  2. However, the Registrar may assign a name to the child if—
    1. the name stated in the birth registration statement is a prohibited name; or
    2. the birth registration statement is lodged by both parents of the child and they satisfy the Registrar that they are unable to agree on the child's name.
LegalDefinitions.Commentary: Similar definitions in other state Births Deaths and Marriages Acts
